title: GMB fans beg 'missing' Piers Morgan to return amid fears he's been 'sacked'
text:

Good Morning Britain fans have been asking where Piers Morgan is, with the host missing another episode this week - as some viewers even questioned if he had been sacked from the show.

Susanna Reid's co-host is currently on an extended break with him often taking time off during the school half-terms.

On Monday morning, several viewers tuned in and expected to see him presenting the show, but he wasn't on again.

Some people had forgotten he was taking a break, while others appeared to expect his time off to be shorter - amid a recent poll calling for him to be dropped from the show.

On the latest episode, actor and presenter Adil Ray took to hosting duties - with him often appearing as a guest host on the ITV series.

(Image: ITV)

While Piers should be back behind the desk around the week of November 11th, viewers are calling for him to come back sooner.

Taking to Twitter , fans admitted they had got out of bed to watch only to find out he wasn't on - while one viewer admitted she was "concerned that Piers had been sacked" because of the recent poll.

One viewer said: "Piers Morgan STILL isn't back, polluting #GMB? What's up?"

(Image: ITV)

Another said: "They are all fighting for dominance when Piers is missing."

A third tweeted: "Well that was a waste of what could have been an interesting interview. Where's Piers when you need him and get rid of 'soft Susannah'?"

This was echoed by a fourth fan who commented: "Come back Piers and quickly," while a fifth asked: "Have I missed it ? Has Piers been sacked?"

(Image: ITV)

Others claimed they had switched off and tuned into the BBC, not happy with the show line-up.

There were viewers who were happy to see a lack of Piers content though, with one fan tweeting: "Turned back to @GMB this morning. Interviews where guests are allowed to speak and the show isn’t merely a vehicle for the host’s right-wing propaganda is definitely more enjoyable.

"I’d watch this every morning. Piers who?"

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV.
description: Some Good Morning Britain viewers are asking for him to return amid a petition from others for him to be axed
